utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Chandler's room. Monica and Chandler are in bed.]

utterances.transcript: Oh, ain't this nice? It's so quiet, I could just lie here all day.
I know.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I know (she snuggles to him) (Rachel runs in)

utterances.transcript: Open your drapes! Open your drapes!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (walking in hurriedly) Open your drapes! Open your drapes!

utterances.transcript: I'm so glad we've got adjoining rooms!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I'm so glad we've got adjoining rooms! (Rachel opens the drapes)

utterances.transcript: The sun is out!
Hey! Remember when I had corneas?
Ok listen, you go down to the pool and reserve the chairs, and I'll get the magazines and the lotion.
Ladies? Ross's speech is in 45 minutes.
Nooo!
Damn it!
Walls are pretty thin, guys!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (from across the wall) Walls are pretty thin, guys!

plots: Rachel is upset the sun just came out but Ross ' speech is in 45 minutes .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Conference room. Ross is making his keynote speech]

utterances.transcript: Then we have to await the data from recent MRI scans and DNA testing which call into question information gathered from years of simple carbon dating.
Look at that woman sitting by the pool getting tan... so leathery and wrinkled, I'm so jealous!
Finally, factoring the profusion of new species recently discovered: Gigantosaurus, Argentinasaurus...
Not to mention the cold sores.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to a paleontologist sitting next to him) Not to mention the cold sores. (the paleontologist glares at Chandler)

utterances.transcript: And that's just the herbivores. I'm not even gonna discuss the carnivores, their heads are already too big. Which is ironic considering their stunted cerebral development.
utterances.transcript_with_note: And that's just the herbivores. I'm not even gonna discuss the carnivores, their heads are already too big. Which is ironic considering their stunted cerebral development. (all the paleontologists laugh)

utterances.transcript: Really?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to the one sitting next to him) Really?

utterances.transcript: But all kidding aside, in much the same way that Homo ergaster is now thought to be a separate species from Homo erectus...
utterances.transcript_with_note: But all kidding aside, in much the same way that Homo ergaster [1] is now thought to be a separate species from Homo erectus... (Joey laughs)

utterances.transcript: What?
He said "erectus"!
You're... you're kidding, right?
No, he really said it.
... and while there are certainly vast differences between these Mesozoic fossiles and the example of Homo erectus...
utterances.transcript_with_note: ... and while there are certainly vast differences between these Mesozoic fossiles and the example of Homo erectus... (Rachel laughs)

utterances.transcript: Erectus?
Homo.

plots: Rachel and Joey giggle over the term
To the other friends ' fury , it keeps raining except during Ross ' speech , which to their amazement is a big hit with the paleontologists .
Joey , Chandler and Rachel laugh and poke fun at the words " erectus " and " homo " during a speech given about fossils , irking the paleontologists seated next to them .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: the hotel conference room]

utterances.transcript: ... in a very real way we can bring the Mesozoic era into the 21st century. Thank you!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (concluding his speech)... in a very real way we can bring the Mesozoic era into the 21st century. (pauses) Thank you! (Everybody stands up and applauds. Ross looks flattered and surprised. His friends and other members of the audience go to congratulate him)

utterances.transcript: Oh, thanks guys!
I thought... it was wonderful!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (shaking hands with Ross) I thought... it was wonderful!

utterances.transcript: Oh!
Jarvis Oberblau, Cornell. I mean, the ideas you put forth and, and from someone... so... young... and... .
utterances.transcript_with_note: Jarvis Oberblau, Cornell. (sighs) I mean, the ideas you put forth and, and from someone... so... young... and... (sighs again and smiles at Ross blissfully).

utterances.transcript: Ok... now... now we're just holding hands!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (with a frozen smile on his face, realizing something's wrong with Jarvis) Ok... now... now we're just holding hands! (pulls his hand away)

utterances.transcript: All right! Well, uh... we're gonna hit the beach?
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right! Well, uh... (to Monica) we're gonna hit the beach?

utterances.transcript: Yeah!
It was really... great!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Ross, in a flattering tone) It was really... great!

utterances.transcript: Oh, thank you so much!
Yeah, and so funny!
Oh!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh! (Rachel, Joey and Chandler pat him on his shoulders and walk off, together with Monica)

utterances.transcript: Ok!... All right, thanks! Thank you so much, you guys! Oh, I can't tell you how much it means to me that you were here!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (puzzled) Ok!... All right, thanks! Thank you so much, you guys! (to Phoebe) Oh, I can't tell you how much it means to me that you were here!

utterances.transcript: You're kidding, we wouldn't have missed it!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (popping by, smiling) You're kidding, we wouldn't have missed it! (Ross is dumbfounded to see Mike instead of David)

utterances.transcript: Oh... I'm back!
Ok!... Uh... excuse me? Yeah?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (skating over, embarrassed) Ok!... Uh... excuse me? Yeah?

utterances.transcript: Yeah!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah! (they leave) (Ross goes towards Charlie, who's conversing with a fellow paleontologist, and touches her shoulder to get her attention)

utterances.transcript: Hey! Well...?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey! (she turns to him) Well...? (in expectation)

utterances.transcript: You were incredible!
Yeah?
You blew them away!
Oh, I can't tell you how great it was to look at the crowd and see your face! I mean... uh, did you know you were mouthing the words along with me?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, I can't tell you how great it was to look at the crowd and see your face! I mean... uh, did you know you were (giggles) mouthing the words along with me?

utterances.transcript: I was not!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (smiling broadly) I was not!

utterances.transcript: No, it's ok! Made me feel like a rock star!
Oh my God! I'm your groupie!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh my God! (pauses) I'm your groupie!

utterances.transcript: I'd better not found you naked in my hotel room!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (joking) I'd better not found you naked in my hotel room! (Ross giggles, but Charlie isn't amused at all.)

utterances.transcript: Look, I took it too far!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (realizing his joke wasn't so good, but still giggling) Look, I took it too far!
[Scene: the hotel lobby. Monica, Phoebe, Chandler and Mike walk in from the outside.]

utterances.transcript: I can't believe it's raining again! Oh, it's so unfair!!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (her hair bigger then before) I can't believe it's raining again! Oh, it's so unfair!!! (They approach the buffet, where a couple of paleontologists are sipping their drinks)

utterances.transcript: Well, on the bright side, now you won't have to see all these paleontologists with their shirts off. Not you guys. You got it going on!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, on the bright side, now you won't have to see all these paleontologists with their shirts off. (Grabs a drink and notices that the two men are upset) Not you guys. You got it going on! (Monica, Phoebe, Chandler and Mike walk away, sipping their drinks)

utterances.transcript: So, what are we gonna do today?
They have a game room downstairs! Ping pong and stuff.
Ping pong? Honey, they have ping pong! Let's play!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (pleasantly surprised) Ping pong? (to Chandler) Honey, they have ping pong! Let's play!

utterances.transcript: I don't think so!
Why not?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (disappointed) Why not?

utterances.transcript: Because you know how competitive you get and well, I say it's cute, others disagree, and I'm lying!
I'm not always that bad!
Oh, yeah? What happened when we played last time?
I punched you...?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (hesitatingly) I punched you...?

utterances.transcript: And...?
... Phoebe...?
I clunked your heads together!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I clunked your heads together! (Chandler turns to Mike and gives him a "See what I mean?" look)

plots: After the speech , while it rains again , Monica and Mike get into a ping - pong match and their competitive sides really take over .
Mike talks about there being a game of pingpong downstairs , but Chandler thinks it 's a bad idea .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Joey and Charlie's room]

(Joey is sitting in an armchair and wearing a diving mask. He pulls out a grape from a bunch of fake grapes on the coffee table, puts it on the snorkel's breathing tube and blows it out, then giggles to himself)

utterances.transcript: Hey! There you are!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (walking in) Hey! There you are!

utterances.transcript: Hey! As soon as it stops raining we have got to go snorkeling! Some kid told me about the sea turtle and, if you blow bubbles in its face, it chases ya!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey! (stands up) As soon as it stops raining we have got to go snorkeling! Some kid told me about the sea turtle and, if you blow bubbles in its face, it chases ya! (smiles ecstatic)

utterances.transcript: I'm sorry, I can't! I'm running a discussion group all afternoon.
Oh... oh, but that's ok, I'll find someone else to do it... I'll do it alone, but... I don't know what happens if the sea turtle catches you...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (disappointed) Oh... oh, but that's ok, I'll find someone else to do it... I'll do it alone, but... I don't know what happens if the sea turtle catches you...

utterances.transcript: You know... I feel so bad! I haven't seen you this whole trip and especially last night...
utterances.transcript_with_note: You know... I feel so bad! I haven't seen you this whole trip and (pauses) especially last night...

utterances.transcript: Hey! Don't worry about it! It was fine! I ended up having the best time with Rachel! I just felt bad for you, stuck in that room, working on Ross's speech...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (interrupting her) Hey! Don't worry about it! It was fine! I ended up having the best time with Rachel! I just felt bad for you, stuck in that room, working on Ross's speech... (pulls a face)

utterances.transcript: Actually, it turned out to be a lot of fun!
Oh! Oh, well! At least we're both having fun!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (bewildered) Oh! Oh, well! At least we're both having fun!

utterances.transcript: Yeah...
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah... (There's an awkward moment of silence)

utterances.transcript: ... is it weird that it's not with each other?
Yeah! A little bit, yeah...
I think we need to talk...!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sitting down on the bed) I think we need to talk...! (pause)

utterances.transcript: Yeah... I think we do... ... about what?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah... I think we do... (sighs, with folded arms)... about what?

plots: Charlie and Joey talk , and Charlie and Joey realize that not having fun with each other is pretty weird and that maybe it 's the time for Charlie and Joey to talk about Charlie and Joey 's relationship .
Charlie tells Joey that Charlie is busy because Charlie is running a discussion group all afternoon .
While on vacation , Ross and Rachel hang out with their friends more than each other .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: the hotel game room. There is a ping pong table in the middle of the room. Monica, Phoebe, Chandler and Mike walk in]

utterances.transcript: C'mon guys, it'll be fun!
All right, all right... I'll play if we don't keep score!
But then how do we know who wins?
Nobody wins!
So, we're just four losers... SUPER!
I'm not playing with you.
Yeah, I'm out.
I'll play ya!
OK!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (smiling) OK!

utterances.transcript: Mike, you don't know, you don't know what you're doing!
She gets crazy! This scar is from Pictionary!
utterances.transcript_with_note: She gets crazy! This scar (points to his forehead) is from Pictionary! (Monica rolls her eyes)

utterances.transcript: I think I will be all right! You wanna volley a bit for a serve?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (disbelieving) I think I will be all right! (to Monica) You wanna volley a bit for a serve?

utterances.transcript: Sure! Got to!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Sure! Got to! (Monica and Mike start to play ping pong. Mike scores)

utterances.transcript: Aww!
Oh, by the way... I'm awesome!!
Oh dear God, there's two of them!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (nearly whispering) Oh dear God, there's two of them!

utterances.transcript: You're ready to play?
Hell, yeah!
Did you know this about him?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Phoebe) Did you know this about him?

utterances.transcript: No idea! I though he was soft like you!
Wanna make it more interesting?
How much were you thinking?
Ten bucks a game?
Make it fifty!
I'll make it a hundred!
One thousand...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (nearly shouting) One thousand...

utterances.transcript: OK!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (interrupting her) OK!

utterances.transcript: To see who goes first, you got a quarter?
No... Either of you girls got a quarter?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (going through her pockets) No... (to Chandler and Phoebe) Either of you girls got a quarter?

utterances.transcript: Honey, try to focus the trash talk on him!
Monica, you call it.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (picks up a coin from her bra) Monica, you call it.

utterances.transcript: Heads! No, Tails! He-he-heads!
Tails!
Ow, what are the chances!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (angry) Ow, what are the chances! (They start playing again)

utterances.transcript: Ha! My point!
Oh, no! I don't think so! You know, according to standard table tennis rules if at any time a player uses his non racket bearing hand to touch the playing surface he or she forfeits the point.
He was a lawyer!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (smiling proudly) He was a lawyer!
[Scene: Rachel's hotel room. She is watching the Weather Channel on TV.]

utterances.transcript: ... all these coasts having beautiful weather. In New York, it's 72 and sunny!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (meteorologist) (pointing to the East Coast)... all these coasts having beautiful weather. In New York, it's 72 and sunny!

utterances.transcript: Oh! Weather bitch!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh! Weather bitch! (turns the TV off) (Someone knocks on the door)

utterances.transcript: It's open! Hi, Joe!
utterances.transcript_with_note: It's open! (Joey walks in) Hi, Joe!

utterances.transcript: Hey...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (downhearted) Hey...

utterances.transcript: What, is everything ok?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (worried) What, is everything ok?

utterances.transcript: Uh... Charlie and I broke up.
Nooooo, why?
Oh well, she said we have nothing in common.
Oh, that's crazy!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (laughing) Oh, that's crazy!

utterances.transcript: No, it's not, we have nothing in common!
... yeah, it's true.
I mean, she should be with someone like... Ross! You know what I mean, he uses all those big words too! Man, smart people are dull!
What, hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (pretending to be offended) What, hey!

utterances.transcript: Ok, Rach!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (laughing sarcastically) Ok, Rach! (He punches her on her shoulder mockingly, then goes and sits down on her bed)

utterances.transcript: I feel so stupid, you know? Why... why do I keep going after the wrong girls?
W-What are you, what are you talking about?
Oh, c'mon, I mean, there's you, then there's Charlie, and it's like... What the hell is my problem? OH!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, c'mon, I mean, there's you, then there's Charlie, and it's like... (sighs) What the hell is my problem? OH! (He falls back on the bed)

utterances.transcript: Ok... uh... maybe you're not always going after the wrong girl...
I'm telling you, Rach, Charlie is not right for me!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sitting up again) I'm telling you, Rach, Charlie is not right for me!

utterances.transcript: Yeah, I'm not talking about her...
But then who? The waitress I went out with last month?
utterances.transcript_with_note: But then who? The waitress I went out with last month? (gives her a meaningful look)

utterances.transcript: You know? Forget it!
No-no-no-no, no! Who, who were you talking about?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (stands up) No-no-no-no, no! Who, who were you talking about?

utterances.transcript: No, I-I-I-I don't, I actually don't know who I'm talking about! So!
Ok! All right, well... I'm gonna see if I can get a room for the night and I'll... I'll see you later!
Yeah, sure!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, sure! (Joey walks out, while Rachel is pensive. Once he's out of her room, he suddenly realizes who she was talking about and goes back in. He looks at her in disbelief and she looks like she was caught red-handed)
[Scene: Rachel's hotel room. Joey is standing at the door, facing Rachel]

utterances.transcript: You like me?
utterances.transcript_with_note: You like me? (shuts the door)

utterances.transcript: Ok, let's not make a big thing about this!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (nearly whispering) Ok, let's not make a big thing about this!

utterances.transcript: That's a huge thing!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (shocked) That's a huge thing!

utterances.transcript: Not working with me, Joe! Here's the thing: lately I have been having thoughts musings, if you will!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Not working with me, Joe! Here's the thing: lately I have been having thoughts (pauses) musings, if you will!

utterances.transcript: What... for how long?
Only like a month!
A MONTH??
utterances.transcript_with_note: (outraged) A MONTH??

utterances.transcript: What the... DIAL IT DOWN! Listen, ok, and maybe they're crazy thoughts, but sometimes I do, I have, I've been thinking about... you know, us! Ok, dial it up a little!
utterances.transcript_with_note: What the... DIAL IT DOWN! (Joey goes to sit on the bed) Listen, ok, and maybe they're crazy thoughts, but sometimes I do, I have, I've been thinking about... you know, us! (looks at Joey, who's totally distraught) Ok, dial it up a little!

utterances.transcript: I just have one question!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (stands up) I just have one question!

utterances.transcript: Shoot!
What the hell are you doin'???
utterances.transcript_with_note: (desperate) What the hell are you doin'???

utterances.transcript: I don't know, I'm not trying to do anything, it's just, we have such a good time when we're together, you know... I mean, aren't you just a... little curious... what that would be like?...
utterances.transcript_with_note: I don't know, I'm not trying to do anything, it's just, we have such a good time when we're together, you know... I mean, aren't you just a... little curious... (insinuating) what that would be like?...

utterances.transcript: Uh, am I curious? I mean, I am as curious as... as... George!!
Who...?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (puzzled) Who...?

utterances.transcript: CURIOUS GEORGE ! You know, the monkey, and the guy with the yellow hat!
utterances.transcript_with_note: CURIOUS GEORGE (see link)! You know, the monkey, and the guy with the yellow hat!

utterances.transcript: Oh yes, of course, I remember him!
Yeah, he had a paper route.
Yeah, he did! Oh, see, this is what I'm talking about!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, he did! (smiling) Oh, see, this is what I'm talking about!

utterances.transcript: No, I know, yeah I know we're great but Rach no... this... this can't happen!
But can it... just... happen a little bit?
NO, NO! It can't happen at all!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (charmed, but then recoiling) NO, NO! It can't happen at all!

utterances.transcript: But why, why not?
Because... look, no one wants this to happen more than me, ok? I have gone over this moment in my head a hundred times and not once did I ever say no! I couldn't do it to Ross!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Because... look, no one wants this to happen more than me, ok? (in a trembling voice) I have gone over this moment in my head a hundred times and not once did I ever say no! (sighs) I couldn't do it to Ross!

utterances.transcript: But that wasn't gonna stop you before!
I know, I know! But I've thought about it a lot since, and it just wouldn't be right... I'm sorry...!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I know, I know! But I've thought about it a lot since, and it just wouldn't be right... (painfully) I'm sorry...!

utterances.transcript: I'm sorry, too! OH GOD! I shouldn't have said anything!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (regretful) I'm sorry, too! (they look at each other sadly, then she recollects, and puts her hands over her eyes) OH GOD! I shouldn't have said anything!

utterances.transcript: NO! No-no-no-no-no-no! Hey! Hey, we'll be fine! Li... hey, like you said: no big deal!
It's not a big deal!
NO BIG DEAL!
It's so not a big deal!
Yeah! I'll see ya later! Yeah!
Ok!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ok! (They shake hands, he walks out and shuts the door, then seems to change his mind, moves to open the door, than changes his mind again and leans over the door. Just then, Rachel opens the door)

utterances.transcript: Ok, I...
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ok, I... (Joey falls backwards into the room)

utterances.transcript: AAAHHHH!
utterances.transcript_with_note: AAAHHHH! (Joey hurriedly stands up, arms akimbo, gives her an embarrassed look and walks away)
[Scene: the hotel game room. Monica and Mike are still playing ping pong]

utterances.transcript: Ooh! I'm sorry! I think, I THINK, that may have missed the table!
Do you?
Ah, yeah!
Do you?
Ah, yeaaah!
DO YOU?
AH YEAAAAH!
Do you really find this attractive on him?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Phoebe) Do you really find this attractive on him?

utterances.transcript: Oh, yeah! Are you telling me you... you're not even... a little turned on by Monica, right now?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (looking at Mike) Oh, yeah! (turning to Chandler) Are you telling me you... you're not even... a little turned on by Monica, right now? (Chandler turns to look at Monica, who has the biggest hair ever, is flushed and in a sweat, and is decidedly sniffing her armpits)

utterances.transcript: I think this is the first time in our marriage that I've felt like the more attractive one.
C'mon Mike, you can beat her! Knock that dog off her head!
utterances.transcript_with_note: C'mon Mike, you can beat her! Knock that dog off her head! (Mike scores)

utterances.transcript: Oh, damn it!
I sleep with him!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (pointing at Mike and shouting) I sleep with him!

utterances.transcript: Game, point!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (boasting) Game, point!

utterances.transcript: Don't get too cocky! Remember I won the last one! Oh, by the way, how did that feel, losing to a girl?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (threatening) Don't get too cocky! Remember I won the last one! Oh, by the way, how did that feel, losing to a girl?

utterances.transcript: You know, you should really look in a mirror before you call yourself that.
utterances.transcript_with_note: You know, you should really look in a mirror before you call yourself that. (they continue to play ping pong and then Mike scores, winning the game)

utterances.transcript: NO, NO, NOOO!
And that's how it's done!
utterances.transcript_with_note: And that's how it's done! (Phoebe kisses him)

utterances.transcript: Okay-dokay, you've each won a game and I've lost what's felt like a year of my life. So everybody goes home a winner.
Best out of three?
That's what I'm thinking.
Should I use my invisibility to fight crime or for evil?
Serve the ball, chump!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Mike) Serve the ball, chump!

utterances.transcript: : Serve the ball, chump.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (doing Monica and mumbling): Serve the ball, chump.

utterances.transcript: Ok Mike, better come back Mike, better come back.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Mike) Ok Mike, better come back Mike, better come back.
[Scene: hotel's bar, Ross and Mr. Oberblau are talking]

utterances.transcript: I'm just saying, I have a cabin in the Adirondacks if you ever want to get away from the city, well, that'd be just nifty!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I'm just saying, I have a cabin in the Adirondacks if you ever want to get away from the city, well, that'd be (pause) just nifty!

utterances.transcript: Ooh, well. Ah, I kinda have got a lot on my plate right now, not that I wouldn't love a weekend in the country with a strange man.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ooh, well. Ah, I kinda have got a lot on my plate right now, not that I wouldn't love a weekend in the country with a strange man. (Mr. Oberblau giggles)

utterances.transcript: Jarvis?
Oh, you're back... this is my wife, Nancy.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (seeing her) Oh, you're back... (to Ross) this is my wife, Nancy.

utterances.transcript: Get Out!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Get Out! (Charlie walks by)

utterances.transcript: Ross, can I talk to you for a minute?
Yes, please! So, what's going on?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yes, please! (they move and sit down on a sofa) So, what's going on?

utterances.transcript: Uh, well... Joey and I broke up.
Oh my God, wh-what happened?
Joey is a great guy, but we're just... so different! I mean, during your speech he kept laughing at homo erectus!
I knew that was him!
Anyway I just, uh, I think it's for the best.
Hey, you ok?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (holding her hand) Hey, you ok?

utterances.transcript: I guess. There was hum... there was another reason that I thought it was time to end it with Joey. I started to realize that I was having feelings for someone else.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I guess. There was hum... (she breathes deeply) there was another reason that I thought it was time to end it with Joey. I started to realize that I was having feelings for someone (pause) else. (some paleontologists interrupt them)

utterances.transcript: Ok Geller. Last day of the conference, you know what happens to the keynote speaker.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (merrily) Ok Geller. Last day of the conference, you know what happens to the keynote speaker.

utterances.transcript: Oh, professor Clerk we're kind of in the middle of a conversation, here.
Yeah, can you guys just throw him in the pool later?
Or we could throw you both in now!
Ok, gentlemen! Please! Aren't we a little old for this? I mean, we're scientists, right? We're academics. And most importantly I... you-you will have to catch us first. . GO, GO, GO!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (standing) Ok, gentlemen! Please! Aren't we a little old for this? I mean, we're scientists, right? We're academics. And most importantly I... you-you will have to catch us first. (he starts to run away with Charlie). GO, GO, GO! (the paleontologists starts chasing them)

plots: The weather in Barbados is finally nice , but only during Ross 's speech .
To break away from the bisexual paleontologist with a crush on him and from the group of scientists who want to throw him in the pool , Ross and Charlie sneak behind a plant in the lobby .
Rachel ca n't hide Rachel 's feelings for Joey anymore , so Rachel decides to tell Joey .
Charlie informs Charlie 's friend that Charlie and Joey are breaking up .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: game room, Monica and Mike are still playing ping pong]
(Chandler and Phoebe look bored to death. Monica scores and laughs)

utterances.transcript: Ok, so it's a tie again, 41 to 41.
Ok, look! Enough is enough!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (exhausted) Ok, look! Enough is enough!

utterances.transcript: No, I have just to have two more points to beat him!

Monica, that was also true an hour ago! I mean, please, look at you! Your hand is blistered, you can barely stand, your hair is inexplicable! Ok, you've already proven you are just as good as he is, now we've missed our dinner reservations, so now let's just go upstairs, order room service, take a shower and shave your head!
I can't just walk away! I've put in four hours!
But...
Look! You knew this about me when you married me! You agreed to take me in sickness and in health. Well, this is my sickness!
What about the obsessive cleaning?
That's just good sense!
utterances.transcript_with_note: That's just good sense! (they start playing again; suddenly Monica hits the table with her hand)

utterances.transcript: Aww!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (in pain) Aww! (she holds her hand, moaning like she's biting back a scream)

utterances.transcript: You ok?
No, no, no. Honey, I'm ok. Shake it off! Oh, no! No shaking, no shaking! Ooh! Ooh! Oh my God! I can't play!
utterances.transcript_with_note: No, no, no. Honey, I'm ok. Shake it off! (she shakes the wrist and it's more painful) Oh, no! No shaking, no shaking! Ooh! Ooh! (pause) Oh my God! I can't play!

utterances.transcript: So you forfeit?
Mike wins?
I can't believe it! I lost!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I can't believe it! (pause) I lost!

utterances.transcript: No, you didn't.
What?
Because I'm gonna play for ya.
You can't do that!
Oh, that's ok. I don't care which of them I beat.
Ok, we're taking that paddle home, mister.
Honey, you don't have to do this.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Chandler) Honey, you don't have to do this.

utterances.transcript: Yes, I do. Now, I may not understand why you have to win so badly, but if it's important to you then it's important to me, because I love you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (In a loving voice) Yes, I do. Now, I may not understand why you have to win so badly, but if it's important to you then it's important to me, because I love you.

utterances.transcript: But... you suck!
You're welcome, sweetheart.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Still in a loving voice) You're welcome, sweetheart. (Chandler prepares to play)

utterances.transcript: All right Mike, let's get this over with. Sudden death. Whoever wins this point, wins.
Ok!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ok! (They start playing and Chandler does not suck at all)

utterances.transcript: Oh my God! You're good!
It's like watching porn!
utterances.transcript_with_note: It's like watching porn! (Chandler scores and wins the match)

utterances.transcript: And that's... how... it's done!
Oh my God. That was so amazing! When did you Hold on! I almost forgot loser! When did you stop sucking?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Chandler) Oh my God. That was so amazing! When did you (pause) Hold on! I almost forgot (she turns to Mike) loser! (back to Chandler) When did you stop sucking?

utterances.transcript: I never sucked, I actually didn't want you to know how good I was!
Why?
I don't know.
This is so great! Now we can enter into doubles tournaments!
That's why!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Hotel's bar. Ross is running to Charlie trying not to be seen with two cocktails in his hands. She's hidden behind a huge plant]

utterances.transcript: Thanks!
Hi.
Are they still looking for us?
Yeah. The bartender said that they split up into two search parties, the herbivores and the carnivores. You know, we as a group are not the coolest.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. The bartender said that they split up into two search parties, the herbivores and the carnivores. (pause) You know, we as a group are not the coolest. (Three paleontologists walk by and Ross hugs Charlie trying not to be seen)

utterances.transcript: I don't think they saw us.
I don't think they did.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I don't think they did. (They realize that they are hugging closely and he draws back)

utterances.transcript: Hum, so, I started to say you something earlier, hum... There was another reason I realized it was time to end it with Joey. I kind of realized I... was starting to have feelings... for someone else.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hum, so, I started to say you something earlier, hum... (pause) There was another reason I realized it was time to end it with Joey. I kind of realized I... was starting to have feelings... for someone else.

utterances.transcript: Oh. Can I... can I ask who?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (apparently unruffled) Oh. Can I... can I ask who?

utterances.transcript: I think you know.
I think I know too but I've been really wrong about this stuff in the past, so...
utterances.transcript_with_note: I think I know too but I've been really wrong about this stuff in the past, so... (Charlie kisses Ross, they stop for a moment and then he kisses her back)

utterances.transcript: I'm sorry... we... we can't.
All right, all right.
I mean, you just went out with my best friend, and I just think it'd be a really really bad idea. Or-or not!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I mean, you just went out with my best friend, and I just think it'd be a really really bad idea. (pause) Or-or not! (they kiss passionately) (Joey walks in and sees Ross and Charlie kissing. He gives a faint, rueful smile, then he seems to recollect something and suddenly he moves back to Rachel's room. He knocks on her door and she opens)

utterances.transcript: What? Homo ergaster: Some scientists classify some African erectus specimens as belonging to a separate species, Homo ergaster, which differs from the Asian H. erectus fossils in some details of the skull .
utterances.transcript_with_note: What? (Joey says nothing, but enters the room and kisses her. They are kissing passionately only to stop for a brief "oh" from Rachel. They continue their passionate kiss and Joey closes the door with his foot and it shuts in the camera's "face". And that's the end of the ninth season.) Homo ergaster: Some scientists classify some African erectus specimens as belonging to a separate species, Homo ergaster, which differs from the Asian H. erectus fossils in some details of the skull (e.g. the brow ridges differ in shape, and erectus would have a larger brain size).

plots: Joey and Charlie realize they do n't have anything in common , and break up .
Meanwhile , Ross and Charlie spend more time together , and realize Ross and Charlie 's feelings for each other .
Ross and Charlie kiss ; Joey sees them , and decides not to let Ross stand between Joey and Rachel .
Ross and Charlie hide from science geeks and kiss , but Joey sees them .
Charlie and Ross are hiding .
Ross runs to Charlie , trying to hide his two cocktails and Charlie hides behind a plant and Charlie and Ross kiss passionately .
Charlie admits that Charlie ended it with Joey because Charlie has feelings for Ross .
Joey ca n't believe that she 's been hiding this from him all this time , but the two decide not to act upon it until they tell Ross about it .
Charlie admits to Ross how she really feels about him , but Ross wants to talk to Joey about this , as Charlie has just broken up with him .
But a couple of seconds later , he regrets this decision and kisses Charlie , which Joey sees .
Joey walks with determination to Rachel 's room and knocks .
Ross kisses Joey 's recent ex-girlfriend , Charlie .
Rachel opens , Joey kisses her , and Rachel kisses him back .
Charlie decides to end Charlie 's relationship with Joey because Charlie has feelings for someone else .
